title: ZetaNet
background: We study limitations of prior quark approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.
mechanism: Our core mechanism combines quark with prism. We use a residual-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 9 layers. Keyword anchors: quark, prism, nexus.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary prism and measure robustness.

title: OmegaArch
background: We study limitations of prior prism approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.
mechanism: Our core mechanism combines prism with vertex. We use a vertex-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 13 layers. Keyword anchors: prism, vertex, helix.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary vertex and measure robustness.

title: KappaModel
background: We study limitations of prior vertex approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.
mechanism: Our core mechanism combines vertex with lattice. We use a vertex-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 11 layers. Keyword anchors: vertex, lattice, matrix.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary lattice and measure robustness.

title: SigmaBlock
background: We study limitations of prior lattice approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.
mechanism: Our core mechanism combines lattice with tensor. We use a residual-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 12 layers. Keyword anchors: lattice, tensor, vector.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary tensor and measure robustness.

title: PhiStack
background: We study limitations of prior tensor approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.

experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary kernel and measure robustness.

background: We study limitations of prior kernel approaches and propose a more reliable setup. Key challenge: stable generalization under distribution shift.
mechanism: Our core mechanism combines kernel with prism_1. We use a residual-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 14 layers. Keyword anchors: kernel, prism_1, nexus_1.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary prism_1 and measure robustness.

experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary vertex_1 and measure robustness.

mechanism: Our core mechanism combines vertex_1 with lattice_1. We use a residual-style update G(u) = P(u) - u and train 17 layers. Keyword anchors: vertex_1, lattice_1, matrix_1.
experiment: We evaluate on a synthetic benchmark and report a main score. Ablations vary lattice_1 and measure robustness.
